  • vfricou.apps.consul role – Install and configure Hashicorp Consul

vfricou.apps.consul role – Install and configure Hashicorp Consul

Note

This role is part of the vfricou.apps collection (version 1.0.0).

It is not included in ansible-core. To check whether it is installed, run ansible-galaxy collection list.

To install it use: ansible-galaxy collection install vfricou.apps.

To use it in a playbook, specify: vfricou.apps.consul.

  • Entry point main – Install and configure Hashicorp Consul

    • Synopsis

    • Parameters

    • Examples

    • Authors

Entry point main – Install and configure Hashicorp Consul

Synopsis

  • Install Hashicorp Consul

  • Configure Hashicorp Consul

  • Manage Server and Agent mode

Parameters

Parameter

Comments

consul_base_dir_path

string

Folder where store consul binaries and datas

Default: "/opt/consul"

consul_conf_bind_address

string

Consul bind address

Default: "0.0.0.0"

consul_conf_client_address

string

Consul client address

Default: "0.0.0.0"

consul_conf_datacenter_name

string / required

Consul datacenter name

consul_conf_domain

string / required

Consul DNS domain

consul_conf_enable_ui

boolean

Enable Consul UI for server

Choices:

  • false

  • true ← (default)

consul_conf_encrypt_key

string / required

Consul encryption key

consul_conf_log_level

string

Consul logging level

Default: "INFO"

consul_download_url

string

Hashicorp Consul download URL base path

Override default URL to specific use URL

By default computed to form {{ consul_download_url_base }}/{{ consul_version }}/consul_{{ consul_version }}_linux_{{ ansible_architecture }}

consul_group

string

System group will run Consul

Default: "consul"

consul_port_dns

integer

Consul DNS port.

Consult https://developer.hashicorp.com/consul/docs/install/ports

Default: 8600

consul_port_grpc

integer

Consul gRPC port

Consult https://developer.hashicorp.com/consul/docs/install/ports

consul_port_grpc_tls

integer

Consul gRPC TLS port

Consult https://developer.hashicorp.com/consul/docs/install/ports

Default: 8503

consul_port_http

integer

Consul HTTP port.

Consult https://developer.hashicorp.com/consul/docs/install/ports

Default: 8500

consul_port_https

integer

Consul HTTPS port.

Consult https://developer.hashicorp.com/consul/docs/install/ports

consul_port_serf_lan

integer

Consul SERF LAN port

Consult https://developer.hashicorp.com/consul/docs/install/ports

Default: 8301

consul_port_serf_wan

integer

Consul SERF WAN port

Consult https://developer.hashicorp.com/consul/docs/install/ports

consul_port_server

integer

Consul Server port

Consult https://developer.hashicorp.com/consul/docs/install/ports

Default: 8300

consul_services

string

Services to declare

consul_username

string

System user will run Consul

Default: "consul"

consul_version

string

Hashicorp Consul version

Default: "1.20.1"

Examples

# Playbook Consul cluster deployment
- name: 'Consul Cluster'
  hosts:
    - consul_cluster
  gather_facts: true
  roles:
    - role: vfricou.apps.consul
      vars:
        consul_conf_domain: "consul"
        consul_conf_datacenter_name: "dc"
        consul_conf_encrypt_key: "<secret_encryption_key>"

# Plakbook Consul agent deployment
- name: 'Consul Cluster'
  hosts:
    - consul_agents
  gather_facts: true
  roles:
    - role: vfricou.apps.consul
      vars:
        consul_conf_domain: "consul"
        consul_conf_datacenter_name: "dc"
        consul_conf_encrypt_key: "<secret_encryption_key>"

# Playbook Consul agent deployment with service - Example for Vault
- name: 'Consul Cluster'
  hosts:
    - consul_agents
  gather_facts: true
  roles:
    - role: vfricou.apps.consul
      vars:
        consul_conf_domain: "consul"
        consul_conf_datacenter_name: "dc"
        consul_conf_encrypt_key: "<secret_encryption_key>"
        consul_services: |
          services {
            id = "vault"
            name = "vault"
            port = 8200
            tags = [
              "vault"
            ]
            check = {
                id = "vault"
                name = "Check Vault API liveness"
                http = "https://127.0.0.1:8200"
                tls_skip_verify = true
                interval = "60s"
            }
          }
